column1: But the apogee of imaginative anti - Nazism comes in Let George Do It ( 1940,To Hell with Hitler in US ), when George Formby, who otherwise divides his time between playing his ukulele and trying to crack the code a bandleader is using to broadcast messages to the Germans, dreams a sequence in which he flies over Berlin in a Zeppelin, lands at a Nuremberg rally and challenges the Führer himself, ‘ You, Adolf, put a sock in it.’
